summary: This document is an email correspondence between Steve Marshal and Theodore Prizio regarding a title overview for a property transaction. Prizio provides details about the title search and current use taxation implications for the property, along with references to various documents related to the property title.

persons.name: Steve Marshal
persons.context: Steve Marshal is the recipient of the email from Theodore Prizio, who is providing an overview of the title to a property.

persons.name: Theodore P. Prizio
persons.context: Theodore P. Prizio is the sender of the email and provides legal insights regarding the title overview and current use taxation for the property.

persons.name: Donald A. Jackson
persons.context: Donald A. Jackson is mentioned as a previous owner of the property, having conveyed it in a deed dated December 14, 2017.

persons.name: Juanita W. Jackson
persons.context: Juanita W. Jackson is mentioned alongside Donald A. Jackson as a co-owner of the property conveyed in the deed.

persons.name: Robert C. Hayes
persons.context: Robert C. Hayes is mentioned in relation to a current use taxation notice recorded in the Merrimack County Registry of Deeds.

connections.description: Donald A. Jackson and Juanita W. Jackson are co-owners of the property conveyed in the deed.
Donald A. Jackson and Robert C. Hayes are mentioned in the context of property ownership and taxation records.

keyFacts: The email discusses a title overview for a property transaction and mentions a Purchase and Sale Agreement.
The title search revealed no issues that could impede marketability or insurability of the property.
Current Use Taxation is applicable to a portion of the property, which restricts subdivision or improvement.
Donald A. Jackson and Juanita W. Jackson are identified as previous owners of the property.
Robert C. Hayes is mentioned in relation to a current use taxation notice recorded in the Registry of Deeds.
